text:
“어. 너는.”
“나도 잘 만나고 왔지.”
“그거 말고.”
둘이 같이 살게 되면서 [redacted_name]는 [redacted_name]이 입덧을 한다는 기막힌 사실을 알게 됐다. 처음부터 알아챈 것은 아니었다. 간혹 입맛이 별로 없다면서 남이 먹는 거만 구경하길래 진짜 그런 줄로만 알았는데, 어느 날 새벽에 [redacted_name]는 그만 목격하고야 말았다. 자다 깼는데 옆자리가 텅 빈 것을 보고 녀석을 찾다가, 도둑놈처럼 주방 구석에 딱 붙어 서서 바나나를 까먹던 모습을.
눈이 마주친 순간에 [redacted_name]이 지었던 표정은 지금도 잊을 수가 없었다. 온몸으로 당황함을 표출하며 손바닥으로 눈가를 덮더니, 어렵사리 꺼내는 말이 이어졌다. 아무래도 입덧을 하는 것 같다고.
네가 그걸 왜 하냐고 물어보는 짓은 하지 않았다. 먹는 입덧 증상을 설명해 주던 부인과 의사가 ‘이런 경우 배우자분이 대리 입덧을 하는 경우도 있다.’ 는 말도 해 줬기 때문이었다. 물론 [redacted_name]이 그 케이스에 해당할 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐지만.
trans:
"Yes, and you?"
"I had a good meeting too."
"Not that one."
As they moved in together, [redacted_name] discovered the surprising fact that [redacted_name] was dealing with morning sickness. It hadn't been obvious at first. He would occasionally mention that he had no appetite and would just watch others eat, so I thought nothing of it. But one morning, I woke up to find the spot beside me empty. I looked around and found him standing in the corner of the kitchen like a thief, trying to sneak a banana.
The expression on [redacted_name]'s face when our eyes met is still unforgettable. He looked completely bewildered, covering his eyes with his palm, struggling to speak. It seemed like he was dealing with morning sickness.
I didn't ask him why he was doing it. Because the gynecologist, while explaining the symptoms of morning sickness, had said, 'In some cases, your spouse may experience morning sickness on your behalf.' Of course, I never thought [redacted_name] would be the one to experience it.
